chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc., a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1m)(b).
  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:37 pm [mo]
Defendant Donna M Anderson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits plea paperwork and supporting documents
  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1,2,4 and plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Anderson guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads- in and dismisses: Count #3

ADA Shock submits victim impact statement
ADA Shock gives sentencing arguments
Mr. Donald Anderson makes a statement. 
Atty. Witt submits photo rifle, marked as Defendant exhibit #1 
Atty. Witt gives sentencing arguments
Statement made by Donna Anderson

On Count #1: 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, concurrent with Counts 2, 4, and 5 to be served in prison system
--pay costs of  $243 plus 200 DNA surcharge= $443,  to be entered as Civil Judgement

On Count #2:
The Court sentences Ms. Anderson to 4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year , and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  3 years , consecutive to any sentence in being, but concurrent with Counts 1, 4 and 5.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any sentence in being or forthwith. 

On Count #4:
The Court sentences Ms. Anderson to 3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years,  concurrent with Counts 1, 2 and 5.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to Count #2 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no consumption or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs. 
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--On Count #2 to pay costs of #268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4 to pay costs of #268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

On Count#5: 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, concurrent with Counts 1,2,and 4 to be served in the prison system 
--pay costs of $243 plus 200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge, to be entered as Civil Judgement

The Court gives  1   days credit for time already served.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:39

case called at 9:15am. [MK]
Defendant Donna M Anderson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  .
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived;  Attorney Witt indicates that he has gone over each of the charges and maximum penalties with Ms. Anderson.
Ms. Anderson waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the Court indicates that the charges and maximum penalties are the same as those set forth in the Complaint
--the Defense stands mute; pleas of "not guilty" entered on the Defendant's behalf 
--Attorney Witt indicates that the Defense is not requesting speedy trial.

The Court requires a $5000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of firearms 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 9:21am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/29/14 at 9:00am (2) Status Conference on 11/14/14 at 1:15pm
